Multiple choice: interrogating chemical reactions

Adapted from DBE Nov 2016 Grade 12, P2, Q1.10
Physical constants ·· Chemistry formulas ·· Periodic table ·· Standard reduction potentials

Equal amounts of zinc powder, Zn(s), react with equal volumes and equal concentrations of HCl(aq) and H2SO4(aq) respectively, as shown below.

The zinc is in excess.

Consider the following statements regarding these two reactions:

I The initial rate at which the acid is used up in test tube X is less than the initial rate at which the acid is used up in test tube Y.
II After completion of the reactions, the amount of zinc that remains in test tube X will be greater than that in test tube Y.
III The amount of hydrogen gas formed in test tube X is less than the amount of hydrogen gas formed in test tube Y.

Which of the above statements is/are true?

A I only
B II only
C III only
D II and III only
Answer:

Reaction rates

Chidiebere and his friend William are carrying out an experiment to calculate reaction rates.

Chidiebere carries out the following reaction:

2Ca(s)+O2(g)→2CaO(s)… reaction 12Ca(s)+O2(g)→2CaO(s)… reaction 1

William carries out the following reaction:

Fe(s)+S(s)→FeS(s)… reaction 2Fe(s)+S(s)→FeS(s)… reaction 2

After 4,9 min4,9 min, 18 g18 g of CaO is produced in the first reaction.

  1. Calculate the rate of the first reaction, using the amount of product that is produced.

    INSTRUCTION:
    • Round your answer to four decimal places.
    • Use the periodic table available here for all molar masses.
    Answer: mol·s−1mol·s−1
    numeric

  2. The rate of moles of Fe used in reaction 22 is the same as the rate of CaO produced in reaction 11. Calculate the minimum mass (in gg) of Fe that is needed for this reaction to take place for 4,9 min4,9 min.

    INSTRUCTION: Round your answer to three decimal places and remember to use unrounded answers from the previous question.
    Answer: gg
    numeric

INSTRUCTION: Write the list with each letter separated by a semi-colon e.g. A; B
A add a catalyst
B grind the solid reactant into a fine powder
C remove a catalyst
D increase the concentration of reactants in solution
E decrease the concentration of reactants in solution
Answer:
one-of
type(list.type(string.nocase))

Co(s)++2HBr(aq) →→ CoBr2(aq)++H2(g)

  2. How will the mass of cobalt present in the flask after completion of the reaction in Experiment 3 compare to the answer to the previous question?
INSTRUCTION: Round your answer to two decimal places.
Answer:
